ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
ygData.msgSnippet: My dad got an HP with a 1Ghz processor and some type of Nvidia card. Nvidia bought 3dfx so their cards are more likely to be compatible with EQ-- the later
ygData.messageBody:
My dad got an HP with a 1Ghz processor and some type of Nvidia card. Nvidia
bought 3dfx so their cards are more likely to be compatible with EQ-- the
later ones that is.
The voodoo 5 works pretty well. I recommend a 32bit rather than 16bit.
There's a sound card.. live audio or something-- I have to ask what it was
again. it sound really really cool.
I hear Gateway is good if you buy during the right time in the season.
luv,
-Su

> Thanks. I am actually looking for name brands too. I dont want to do the
> big purchase only to find out my Video card blows and the drivers for it
> dont work with eq that well ect ect. I play on a 350 PII lap top with
> 128megram and 8mb video card now. But it has a lot of driver problems ( I
> see Enchanter pets!! Btw they look like humans) Nobody has the right shoes
> on (everyone has really funky tie dyed shoes) I wont list all my problems
> here. But if anyone out there has a system they think is perfect for EQ
let
> me know what you have. Thanks again
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: The Mad Macinchaote [mailto:scendera@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 11:01 AM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
>
>
> A good video card and lots of ram should be your biggest concerns. CPU
speed
> doesn't matter nearly as much as ram seems to. I've played EQ on 2 450's
> before...almost identical, but one with 128 megs ram, the other with 256.
> Zones loaded much faster on the one with the extra ram, and the lag on 56k
> modems seems minimized. A good video card should help with the lag too.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 <mailto:nygaardr@...>
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com' <mailto:'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'>
> Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 12:29 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Great EQ Computer?
>
> I will be buying a computer in a few months and am wondering what some of
> you people use to play EQ. Going to spend a good bit so anyone have any
> suggestions for GREAT eq computer (that's about all I do with the computer
> play EQ, Web and MP3's). Anyone have any ideas?
>
> Mu
